question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the CMA will declare the conclusion of a significant pharmaceutical pricing inquiry by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) publicly states that its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major firms has been completed. The conclusion must be verified through an official announcement from the CMA or reported by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not make an announcement regarding the completion of this investigation by the specified date, or if the investigation remains active, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will the CMA not announce completion of a major pharmaceutical pricing investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK does not officially announce the completion of its investigation into pharmaceutical pricing practices involving at least five major companies. If the CMA announces the completion of such an investigation by this date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the CMA fail to declare the conclusion of a significant inquiry into pharmaceutical pricing before July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) in the UK has not officially declared the conclusion of its investigation concerning pharmaceutical pricing practices that involve at least five major companies. If the CMA does announce the conclusion of this investigation by that date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Columbia University remove any individual's name from its buildings due to public pressure by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Columbia University officially announces the removal of any individual's name from any of its campus buildings due to public pressure. The announcement must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The removal must be specifically due to public pressure. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Columbia explicitly states they will not remove any such names by this date, the question resolves as NO. Note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial statements about potential removal do not count as a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Columbia University take down any person's name from its buildings in response to public outcry by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Columbia University makes an official declaration regarding the removal of any person's name from any of its campus buildings as a result of public outcry. The declaration must be covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The removal must be specifically attributed to public outcry. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if Columbia clearly states they will not be removing any such names by this date, the inquiry will resolve as NO. It is important to note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial remarks regarding possible removals do not qualify as a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Columbia University not remove any individual's name from its buildings due to public pressure by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Columbia University does not officially announce the removal of any individual's name from any of its campus buildings due to public pressure. Alternatively, if Columbia explicitly states they will not remove any such names by this date, the question also resolves as YES. If Columbia University does announce such a removal and it is reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press), specifically due to public pressure, the question resolves as NO. Note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial statements about potential removal do not count as a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Will Columbia University refrain from taking down any person's name from its buildings because of public influence by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Columbia University has not made an official declaration regarding the removal of any person's name from any of its campus buildings due to public influence. Additionally, if Columbia explicitly indicates that they will not remove any such names by this date, the inquiry also resolves as YES. Conversely, if Columbia University does announce a removal and it is covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press), specifically as a result of public influence, the inquiry resolves as NO. It is important to note that discussions, petitions, or unofficial remarks concerning potential removals do not contribute to a NO resolution.

question.title: Will Sacramento County authorize events on cornfields by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is an official policy change or announcement by local authorities in Sacramento County, California, allowing events such as weddings and agricultural fairs to be hosted on cornfields. The policy change must be documented in government records or reported by at least two major news outlets. The authorization should specifically apply to small cornfield owners in the Sacramento County region. If no such policy change or announcement occurs by the resolution date, or if the change does not explicitly include cornfields, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Sacramento County permit gatherings on cornfields before July 2024?

The change must be recorded in government documentation or reported by a minimum of two prominent news organizations. The permission should specifically target small cornfield proprietors within the Sacramento County area. para_P.title: Will events on cornfields be prohibited in Sacramento County by July 2024?

question.title: Will Apple finalize a union contract with store employees in New York by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in New York. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Apple, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers' Coalition of Organized Retail Employees, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The contract must be the first of its kind for Apple in the United States. If no such finalization and signing of the contract occurs by the specified date, or if the contract is still in a tentative or non-finalized state, the question resolves as NO.

Conversely, if such an agreement is finalized and signed by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Alex Jones face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, new bankruptcy proceedings are initiated against Alex Jones, as confirmed by official court records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The proceedings must be separate from and unrelated to any previous bankruptcy cases. If no such new proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, 'new bankruptcy proceedings' refer to any formal legal action filed in a bankruptcy court that names Alex Jones as the debtor, whether it's a voluntary filing by Jones himself or an involuntary petition filed by creditors.

question.title: Will Skagway, Alaska, vote to ban cruise ships on Fridays by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city of Skagway, Alaska, has held an official vote (either by city council or public referendum) on implementing a ban on cruise ships docking on Fridays, and the outcome of this vote is in favor of such a ban. The vote must be specifically about banning cruise ships on Fridays, not a general restriction on cruise ships. The result of the vote must be confirmed by official city announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or local Alaskan news outlets). If no such vote has taken place, or if a vote occurs but does not result in approval of a Friday ban, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question is about the vote itself, not the implementation of the ban.

para_P.title: Will the city of Skagway in Alaska decide to prohibit cruise ships on Fridays before July 2024?

question.title: Will the USDA distribute over $2 billion to urban farmers by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has distributed more than $2 billion in federal aid specifically to urban farmers, as part of a program supporting agriculture in urban areas. The distribution must be confirmed by official USDA reports or statements and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the total distributed amount is less than or equal to $2 billion by the specified date, or if the distribution is not specifically targeted at urban farmers, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'distributed' means the funds have been successfully transferred to the intended recipients.

question.title: Will Boehringer Ingelheim allow generic production of its COPD medication by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Boehringer Ingelheim officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its COPD medication, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Boehringer Ingelheim continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Boehringer Ingelheim permit the creation of generic versions of its COPD treatment by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Boehringer Ingelheim makes an official announcement or confirmation that it will permit the generic production of its COPD medication, thereby choosing not to enforce its patent. This could occur through a formal retraction of the patent, a voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that facilitates unrestricted generic manufacturing. Verification must be derived from official announcements from the company, statements from relevant regulatory agencies, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation occurs by the specified deadline, or if Boehringer Ingelheim continues to uphold its patent rights, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Boehringer Ingelheim not allow generic production of its COPD medication by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Boehringer Ingelheim does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its COPD medication, effectively continuing to enforce its patent. This could mean no formal patent withdrawal, no voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production is announced. Confirmation of continued enforcement must come from the lack of official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Boehringer Ingelheim prevent the production of generic versions of its COPD drug by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, Boehringer Ingelheim has not made any official declaration or confirmation regarding the allowance of generic production of its COPD medication, thereby maintaining its patent rights. This implies that there will be no formal withdrawal of the patent, no voluntary licensing agreement, or any other means that would permit unrestricted generic production announced. Evidence of ongoing patent enforcement must be indicated by the absence of official announcements from the company, statements from relevant regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until the end of August 2024?

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

question.body:

4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state constitution or law. The referendum must be officially announced by the Texas Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of abortion rights protection. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Russia announce an exceptional yield for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially announces an exceptional yield for both wheat and sunflowers, signifying yields that are above the average when compared to the previous five-year period. An exceptional yield is characterized as a crop output that is considerably above average, generally at least 10% greater than the five-year average. Verification must be obtained from official statements by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or from at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If an exceptional yield is declared for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not for both, or if no exceptional yield is reported for either crop, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia does not officially report a bumper harvest for either wheat or sunflowers, meaning that at least one of the crops does not have higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Lack of confirmation must be evident from the absence of official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or fewer than three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS) reporting a bumper harvest for both crops. If a bumper harvest is reported for both crops, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, there is no official declaration from Russia concerning a significant harvest of either wheat or sunflowers, indicating that at least one of the crops does not achieve yields that are above the average when compared to the last five years. A significant harvest is characterized as a yield that substantially exceeds the average, generally at least 10% more than the five-year average. The absence of confirmation must be clear from the lack of official statements from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or if fewer than three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS) report a significant harvest for both crops. Conversely, if both crops are reported to have a significant harvest, the question will resolve as FALSE.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Larry Page on X by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Larry Page must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Wisconsin hold a referendum on mental health services funding by August 2024?
